item.title: Sens fans eager for matchup with Rangers
item.description: Ottawa hockey fans are excited about a return trip to the playoffs for the Senators and are cautiously optimistic about their team's chances against the Eastern Conference's top seed.

item.title: Dry winter brings drought worries for Ottawa-area farmers
item.description: An unusually dry winter and spring has Ottawa-area farmers dipping into their water reserves and concerned about what they say could be a bad growing season.

item.title: Vimy Ridge ceremony draws thousands of Canadians
item.description: Thousands of Canadian students joined the Governor General and the minister of veterans affairs in France to mark the 95th anniversary of the Battle of Vimy Ridge.

item.title: False sex registry match forces man to prove innocence
item.description: A Brockville, Ont., man says he has spent a lot of time and money trying to clear his name, and may lose his job because he has the same date of birth as a man on a list of pardoned sex offenders.

item.title: NDP, Liberals continue budget discussions
item.description: Ontario's Liberal government is not ruling out adding to its budget an NDP proposal for a tax increase on the province's wealthiest.

item.title: Canadian space programs face budget cuts, layoffs
item.description: Canadian Space Agency cuts announced in the recent budget might hurt critical programs, aerospace industry leaders worry.

item.title: Ottawa lung recipient doing some breathing on own
item.description: An Ottawa woman who received a double lung transplant this week was doing some breathing on her own, her family announced on Twitter.

item.title: Firefighters battle grass fire in Val-des-Monts
item.description: Firefighters in Val-des-Monts, Que., have requested air support to battle a large grass fire that broke out Sunday afternoon.

item.title: MacKay aware of F-35s' extra $10B cost
item.description: Defence Minister Peter MacKay says he was aware two years ago that it would cost closer to $25 billion to buy a new fleet of F-35 stealth fighter jets.

item.title: Canucks, Senators highlight HNIC coverage
item.description: Hockey Night in Canada is showing the series featuring the Vancouver Canucks and Ottawa Senators, who will try to bring the Stanley Cup back to Canada for the first time since 1993.

item.title: How does ur txting affect ur writing?
item.description: Researchers at the University of Ottawa, Simon Fraser University and the University of Montreal are collecting SMS messages to look at how texting affects the way Canadians write.

item.title: Magnitude 3.1 earthquake hits Wakefield, Que., area
item.description: Earthquakes Canada registered a magnitude 3.1 earthquake about 15 kilometres east of Wakefield, Que., (26 kilometres north of Ottawa) at 5:47 p.m. Saturday.

item.title: Fire displaces Orléans family
item.description: A family of four was forced to find a temporary home Easter weekend after a fire badly damaged an Orléans bungalow on Saturday night.

item.title: School board blasted for plan to bar Bible handouts
item.description: An Ontario public school board's decision to ban distribution of Gideon Bibles to its young students has unleashed a torrent of threatening calls and hateful emails directed at trustees.
